Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C1QN656 - insured allied enterprises llc (chalhoub) - tanagra moe - rain damages - 16 04 2024 -\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Hi Vic,

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

chunks.text:
The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

EXTERNAL EMAIL

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details:

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details:

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details:

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

 



 

Nasco Middle East

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims 

 



 

Nasco Middle East

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the email with the various documents. We have noted that you have seemingly incurred costs totalling AED 128,500.00 excl. VAT for the remedial works.

 

At this stage and per our request of 9 July 2024, we note we requested the following:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).

 

Please can you ensure that these are shared to enable us to make sure that, a. the scope and costs incurred are reasonable in respect of the original fit-out cost, and, b. that we can review and consider the potential subrogated recovery opportunities arising.

 

Please do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

 



David Russell​​​​

Dear Hagop

 

Thank you for the time on the call earlier – it was much appreciated.

 

As per our discussions, we understand that at the moment you are currently obtaining alternative quotations for the remedial works required and we shall be pleased to receive these once available. At this stage, we do note that costs appear to be circa AED 120,000.

 

To assist with our ongoing enquiries and in addition to the further quotations, please can you share with me:

 

1.	Confirmation of the original fit-out cost of the entrance façade when installed – perhaps from the BOQ.
2.	Copy of the lease agreement with Mall of the Emirates (to assist with any potential subrogated recovery opportunity).
3.	Videos taken at the time of the incident.

 

Look forward to hearing from you and do reach out should you have any questions.

 

Kind Regards

 

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims 

 



 

Nasco Middle East
P.O. Box 62528, Dubai, UAE

David

ig-gulf.com <mailto:par.claims@gig-gulf.com> >
Subject: RE: Insured: Allied Enterprises LLC (Chalhoub) - Tanagra MOE - Rain Damages - 16/04/2024 - Nasco claim# 66-FIR-2024-06-000228 || 13/FA/2013495

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please find below incident details: 

 

The Tanagra store in Mall of the Emirates (MOE) suffered significant damage due to the intense rainfall. The incident, which occurred around April 15-16, due to vulnerabilities in the building's structure, water infiltration that caused damage to the facade.

 

As water seeped behind the facade, it was absorbed by the wooden backing of the store's signage, causing it to swell and bulge outward. This expansion exerted pressure on the glass panels of the facade, resulting in cracks and breakages across several areas. The severity of the damage necessitated the closure of one of the store's entrances, significantly impacting the customer experience and potentially harming the brand's image.

 

The store management maintained ongoing communication with the Mall's Facility Management team throughout the storm, as the leakage was a persistent issue during the weather event. The damaged area has been barricaded by mall security to ensure customer safety.

 

We have requested the mall for a permanent solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

 

The repair quotations will be sent to you shortly in a follow-up e-mail.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Head of General Claims

P.O. Box 62528, Dubai, UAE
